EmailTemplate.textOnly:
PIVOTAL FIELD OPERATIONS A Message from Greg Stroud SEPTEMBER 2015 SALES NEWS FLASH Global Field Sales Team,
As we focus on closing Q3 business, please take a moment to read this communication carefully as there are operational updates that you should be aware of.
Save the Date - 2016 WWSKO is Coming back to SF Pivotal’s World Wide Sales Kickoff (WWSKO) will be returning to San Francisco Sunday January 24 - Friday 29th and will take place at the Marriott Marquis Hotel right in downtown near the Moscone Center. Stay tuned for more information in the upcoming weeks.
New Customer Briefing Program It is with great pleasure that we introduce Daniel Opine <http://info.pivotal.io/E0C0I0DnUbd0A09J2g0oN0d>, as Pivotal's very own Customer Briefing Advisor. Daniel will assume day-to-day management of the Customer Briefings Program, acting as both master scheduler and primary point of contact to the field.
How to reach the team For general program related questions, please use our new email alias at sales-briefings@pivotal.io <http://info.pivotal.io/kI0oN0A00gD02UC9dd0co0J>. This email alias includes a team of briefing experts that will help get you started and point you in the right direction.
How to schedule a Customer Briefing All requests for Customer Briefing support will require the requester to complete the Pivotal Briefing Request Form <http://info.pivotal.io/c0o029DI0NAU0dCJp0ddg00>. Once the form is submitted, your input will automatically be sent to the Sales Briefings team and a representative will be in contact with you within 48 hours to confirm your briefing.
How to learn more about the Customer Briefing Program
To learn more about the program, please refer to the Program Overview presentation <http://info.pivotal.io/TqAIg0D0d000dUe20No9CJ0> that will help you better understand the processes including, meeting types defined and role & responsibilities. You can also attend our Spotlight Webinar on October 15th, 2015.
2H SPIFs Update Announcing a new SPIF for Sales reps who resell CloudBees. Sales Reps will be awarded either $1K, $2K, or $4k depending on the size of the SKU (see chart below). List price is non-discountable. For full details, please visit FY15 Compensation SPIF deck <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1zOCuVNQX7vEa0F1zoTu1EA6V0GavDFHWDErktdkEEqU/edit#slide=id.gc36c4b54f_0_0>.
Subscription Club Event Dates and Location Confirmed. In August we announced a new second-half SPIF to drive subscription sales. If you achieve your second-half quota for subscription software, you'll become part of the "Subscription Club," which earns you and your partner an awesome weekend adventure with top Pivotal salespeople from around the world.
As you read in Bill’s note, this four-day, three-night adventure will take place on May 21—24 2016, at the W Hotel <http://info.pivotal.io/CUp00H0qN2rI0ACP2N0dJ0e> in South Beach, Miami, Florida—otherwise known as the American Riviera. We took a quick look at those of you in the running for the Subscription Club, and the current tally stands at more than 50 people. Calculations are based on 3rd-quarter actuals, plus 25% of the pipeline for the 2nd-half. We included anyone that is >70%. Note: Your subscription goal is the software threshold for your second half total goal, 50% of your second half goal in Americas, and 70% in EMEA and APJ. We'll post the leaderboard periodically, so get your deals rolling!
Product Update - Photon Availability Project Photon OS is available now as an open source project on GitHub <https://vmware.github.io/photon/>. VMware Photon Controller is expected to be made available as a private beta in Q4 2015. You may read the VMware press release details here <http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/vmw-newsfeed/VMware-Previews-vSphere-Integrated-Containers-and-Photon-Platform-to-Accelerate-Cloud-Native-Apps-in-the-Enterprise/1984726#sthash.CvpRYZJ3.dpuf>. Have a customer that would be interested in direct availability or beta testing? If so, please reach out to Ian Andrews (iandrews@pivotal.io <mailto:iandrews@pivotal.io>).
GSS Update - Escalating to Support for Critical Issues Wondering how to escalate a customer issue to Pivotal GSS (Global Support Services)? Two usual scenarios call for the attention of GSS Management or additional support from Engineering or Subject Matter Expertise:
- Severe Customer business impact
- Create a Severity1 ticket - Full details surrounding tech issue and customer impact - GSS Mgmt will engage Engineering, Escalation Mgmt and SME resources as required
- Growing customer or account concern with open issues or confidence with Pivotal products
- Email gss-escalation@pivotal.io <mailto:gss-escalation@pivotal.io> with details of concern and list any open GSS tickets - GSS Mgmt. will review the account and use analytical tools and resources to resolve and provide regular updates
More Details found at: https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/inside-pivotal-support/
Be Bold! Greg
